question_text: Using the ACE equation ACE = -ΔP_tie - 10 B (f_m - f_s) + ME + T, compute ACE when ΔP_tie = 20 MW, B = -100 MW/0.1 Hz, f_m = 60.05 Hz, f_s = 60.0 Hz, ME = 0 MW, and T = 0 MW.

Using the time error equation \varepsilon_t = \int_0^T (f(t) - f_{nom}) / f_{nom} \, dt, compute \varepsilon_t when system frequency is constant at f(t) = 60.03 Hz, nominal frequency f_{nom} = 60.0 Hz, and T = 300 s.

Using the AGC PI controller equation \Delta P_{g,i} = -\left( K_{P,i} \cdot ACE + \frac{1}{T_{I,i}} \int ACE \, dt \right), compute \Delta P_{g,i} for a constant ACE of 25 MW over 60 s, with K_{P,i} = 0.2 and T_{I,i} = 30 s.
